page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: There are seventeen farms in our area. They are called Rodridge Cottage Farm, Blakeley Hill Farm,Black Hurworth Farm ,White Hurworth Farm,Leechmire Farm, Tilery Farm,Wood Close Farm,Woodlands Close Farm,Fleet Shot Farm,Hulam Farm, Fairfield Farm Rodridge Farm,Village Farm,Sheraton Hill Farm,Hart Bushes Hall and Catlow Hall Farm and Lamb's Close Farm.The biggest farm is Hulam Farm with 600 acres of land,and the smallest is the Village Farm with 5 acres of land,most of which is used for chicken houses.Most of the farming in the area is mixed farming.The crops grown include wheat,barley,potatoes, cabbage,lettuce,broad beans and rape. Most farmers keep beef cattle,dairy herds,sheep pigs andhens.The chicken farm breeds chickens then sends them to factories.There is little woodland.
